meanings.definition: To flavor or season with garlic.
meanings.sent1: She garlicked the pasta for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: I always garlick my bread before baking it.
meanings.sent3: The chef garlicked the soup so much that it could ward off vampires.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the garlicked dish filled the entire kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The roasted vegetables were perfectly garlicked to perfection.

meanings.definition: Having a strong smell or taste of garlic.
meanings.sent1: The garlicked bread made my mouth water.
meanings.sent2: The garlicked sauce added a delicious kick to the dish.
meanings.sent3: His garlicked breath could be smelled from across the room.
meanings.sent4: The garlicked pizza was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent5: The garlicked shrimp had a pungent aroma that lingered in the air.
